security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill definition file containing only documentation and references to security tools. No executable code, network calls, or file system access. The skill activates on keywords and provides workflow guidance for security validation tasks.

content.user_title: Validate security and scan for vulnerabilities
content.value_statement: Security vulnerabilities can lead to data breaches and system compromises. This skill provides automated security validation, vulnerability scanning, and compliance checking for your Python projects using industry-standard tools.
actual_capabilities: Run Bandit security scanner on Python source code
Check dependencies for known vulnerabilities using pip-audit and Safety
Validate GPG and SSH key configuration
Execute Semgrep security rules for code analysis
Provide pre-commit and pre-release security checklists
limitations: Does not fix vulnerabilities automatically - only identifies them
Requires uv and security tools to be installed
Does not perform penetration testing or dynamic analysis
Security checks are limited to configured tools and rules

use_cases.title: Pre-commit security checks
use_cases.description: Run security scans before committing code to catch vulnerabilities early in the development cycle.

use_cases.title: Dependency vulnerability scanning
use_cases.description: Audit project dependencies for known security vulnerabilities before deployment.

use_cases.title: Compliance validation
use_cases.description: Verify that projects follow OWASP Top 10 security considerations and meet compliance requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Scan for vulnerabilities
prompt_templates.scenario: Run a security scan on the codebase
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a full security scan on this project. Include Bandit, pip-audit, Safety check, and Semgrep. Report all findings with severity levels.

prompt_templates.title: Validate GPG signing
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate that GPG signing is properly configured for this repository. Check that a valid secret key exists and git is configured to sign commits.

prompt_templates.title: OWASP compliance check
prompt_templates.description: Check this codebase for OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities. Focus on injection risks, authentication issues, and sensitive data exposure.
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this codebase against OWASP Top 10 security risks. Identify any potential issues with injection flaws, broken authentication, or sensitive data exposure. Provide specific file locations and remediation suggestions.

prompt_templates.title: Pre-release security audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a comprehensive pre-release security audit. Run all security scanners, verify no secrets are committed, confirm dependencies are updated, and ensure all identified vulnerabilities are addressed.

output_examples.input: Run a full security scan on this project
output: Bandit found 3 medium severity issues in src/utils/auth.py: hardcoded password, weak hashing algorithm, missing input validation
pip-audit identified 2 vulnerable dependencies: django < 4.2.5 and requests < 2.31.0
Safety check found 1 critical vulnerability: pyyaml with code execution risk
Semgrep detected potential SQL injection in src/db/query.py line 42
Recommendation: Update django to 4.2.5+, use parameterized queries, and remove hardcoded credentials

best_practices: Run security scans as part of your pre-commit hook to catch issues before code reaches the repository
Address high and critical severity vulnerabilities immediately - do not defer them to future sprints
Keep security tools updated and regularly run comprehensive scans to detect new vulnerabilities in dependencies
anti_patterns: Ignoring low-severity findings - these can often be chained to create more severe attacks
Skipping security scans to meet deadlines - technical debt accumulates quickly
Using security scanning only at deployment time instead of integrating throughout development

faq.question: Which security tools does this skill use?
faq.answer: The skill integrates with Bandit for Python code analysis, pip-audit and Safety for dependency scanning, and Semgrep for rule-based security checks.

faq.question: Does this skill automatically fix vulnerabilities?
faq.answer: No. The skill identifies and reports vulnerabilities but does not modify code or update dependencies automatically.

faq.question: How do I integrate security checks into CI/CD?
faq.answer: The referenced tools can be added as CI steps. The skill provides command examples for GitHub Actions integration.

faq.question: Is my code and data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. All scans run locally on your machine. No code or secrets are transmitted to external services.

faq.question: What Python versions are supported?
faq.answer: The skill works with Python 3.9+ projects. Security tools may have specific version requirements documented in pyproject.toml.

faq.question: How does this compare to cloud-based security scanners?
faq.answer: This skill runs scans locally, keeping your code private. Cloud scanners may offer additional databases and integrations but require sending code externally.
